data.subtitle: - 1. Interface 1
data.desc:
1 Basic Information Window

2 XP Bar

3 Target Information Window

data.subtitle: - 2. Interface 2
data.desc:
1 Menu

2 Quickbar

3 Compass

4 Chat Window

data.subtitle: - 1. Movement
data.desc:
You can move with the mouse or keyboard.

The spacebar lets you jump.

data.subtitle: - 2. Keyboard Movement
data.desc:
To move your character with the keyboard, press the <W, S, A, D, Q, E> keys.

The direction of movement changes depending on the key pressed.

data.subtitle: - 3. Changing Camera Angles
data.desc: Change your camera angle by holding down the right mouse button and moving the mouse.

data.subtitle: - 4. Zooming IN/OUT
data.desc: To zoom the camera view, turn the scroll wheel.

data.subtitle: - 5. View Opposite Angle
data.desc:
Click the scroll wheel to see the front of your character.

Click again to go back.

data.subtitle: - 1. Chat
data.desc: Placing the mouse cursor over an NPC turns the cursor into a speech bubble. Double-Clicking it opens the NPC dialogue window.

data.subtitle: - 2. Quest Guide
data.desc:
A Quest is a task given by an NPC.

You may receive XP (Experience Points), items and/or Kinah (money) as rewards when you complete a quest.

Press the Accept button in the dialogue window to start the quest.

data.subtitle: - 1. Quest Indicator
data.desc:
The Quest Indicator is a window shown on the right side of the screen that displays a summary of the quest's progress.

Clicking the check box next to a quest in the Quest window (Default <J> key) keeps the quest visible in the Indicator.

data.subtitle: - 1. Dictionary Window
data.desc:
Clicking blue text in a Quest Window opens a Dictionary Window.

Clicking the button in the Dictionary Window displays the location of the target on the Map Window and Compass.

data.subtitle: - 1. General Combat
data.desc:
Moving the cursor over an attack target changes it to a sword.

Double clicking the target begins combat.

data.subtitle: - 1. Looting Items
data.desc: You can search for loot by clicking the body of a fallen opponent.

data.subtitle: - 1. Combat Skills
data.desc:
You can fight more easily by using skills.

Select a target to attack, then click the skill icon on your Quickbar.

Pressing the number key matching the number on the icon also activates the skill.

data.subtitle: - 1. Automatic Item Looting
data.desc:
To pick up all loot automatically, select the target and click the <Loot> icon on the Quickbar.

You can also Shift-Double-Click the item.

data.subtitle: - 1. Wearing Equipment
data.desc:
You can wear an equipment item by double-clicking it in the Inventory window <I key>.

Do the same to move the item when buying or selling.

data.subtitle: - 1. Manastone Socketing
data.desc:
A Manastone adds special powers to an equipment item.

Open the inventory, double-click on a Manastone, then click on an equipment item to strengthen the equipment.

To remove the Manastone, visit a Manastone Remover in a fortress or village.

data.subtitle: - 1. Campaign Quests
data.desc:
Your character's story in the world of Aion is composed of Campaign Quests.

You can find Campaign Quests by talking to NPCs with Yellow Arrows above their heads.

data.subtitle: - 1. Binding to Obelisks
data.desc:
Double-clicking on an Obelisk will bind you to it, and you will return there after death.

To view your current obelisk, view the tool tip of the Return skill in your Quickbar.

data.subtitle: - 1. Buying Skill Manuals
data.desc: Talk to a Master or Trainer of your chosen class and press the Buy Skill Manual button in the Shop window.

data.subtitle: - 2. Learning a Skill
data.desc: You can learn a skill by double-clicking its Skill Manual in your Inventory.

data.subtitle: - 3. Placing Icons on a Quickbar
data.desc:
You can place icons you use often, such as skills or food, on your Quickbar.

Drag the skill from the Skill window (default <K> key) and place it in an empty slot on the Quickbar.

data.subtitle: - 1. Chain Skill Guide
data.desc:
A Chain Skill is a set of skills that have additional effects when used in the right sequence.

You can view the information of the Chain Skill by clicking the Chains button in the Skills window.

data.subtitle: - 2. Using a Chain Skill
data.desc:
When the first skill in a Chain Skill is activated, the skill icon on the Quickbar changes to the icon of the next skill in the chain.

The icon of the activated Chain Skill is also displayed in the center of the screen.

To activate the next skill in the chain, Click the icon on the Quickbar, Click the icon on the screen, or press the corresponding number key.

data.subtitle: - 1. Channel Guide
data.desc: The Local Channel is where you can talk to other players who are in the same region as you.

data.subtitle: - 2. Channel Conversation
data.desc:
To use the Local Channel, type "/1" in the Chat window and press the space bar.

You can also click the speech bubble, then select "/1 Local Channel".

data.subtitle: - 3. Closing Channels
data.desc:
To close a channel, type "/Normal" and press the space bar.

You can also click the speech bubble, then select "/Normal".

data.subtitle: - 1. Group Guide
data.desc:
Try forming a group if you wish to explore the world of Aion with new friends.

You can form a group of up to six players.

data.subtitle: - 2. Inviting to Group
data.desc:
Click on the character you want to invite with the right mouse button, and choose Invite to Group from the pop-up menu.

Typing "/Invite CharacterName" in the Chat window and pressing the <Enter> key also sends an invitation to the character.

data.subtitle: - 1. Spread Wings
data.desc:
You can spread your wings and take flight by pressing the <Flight> icon or the <Page Up> key.

When you enter a flying zone the <Flight> button on the bottom right of the screen becomes active.

data.subtitle: - 2. Change Flight Direction
data.desc:
You can also change direction while flying by pressing the <W, S, A, D, Q, E> keys on the keyboard.

Press the <R> key to climb higher, and the <F> key to descend lower.

data.subtitle: - 3. Fold Wings
data.desc:
When your remaining flight time falls to 15 seconds, the flying gauge turns red.

Pressing the <Flight> button or the <Page Down> key when you are near the ground enables you to stop flying.
